thread.title: Fire substantially damages art and tech block at Auckland's Long Bay College
thread.title_full: Fire substantially damages art and tech block at Auckland's Long Bay College

author: Michael Daly
title: Fire substantially damages art and tech block at Auckland's Long Bay College
text:
Fire substantially damages art and tech block at Auckland's Long Bay College MICHAEL DALY Last updated 06:48, February 24 2017 SUPPLIED 
Between 15 and 20 fire trucks were sent to the large blaze at Long Bay College. 
Fire has substantially damaged the art and technology block at Long Bay College closing the high school in the north of Auckland. 
The alarm was raised around 2.35am on Thursday, Fire Service northern communications shift manager Scott Osmond said. 
Between 15 and 20 fire trucks were sent to the large blaze, which caused "fairly substantial" damage. ZIZI SPARKS/FAIRFAX NZ 
Fifty firefighters are still dampening down the early morning Long Bay College blaze. 
By 5am the fire was under control and firefighters were concentrating on dampening down hotspots. 
READ MORE: 
Fifty firefighters remain on scene. 
There were no particular hazards, Osmond said. "Just a large fire that had to be dealt with." 
An investigator would be at the scene later on Friday to try to determine the cause of the fire. 
Long Bay College posted on Facebook about the school being closed. 
TOUGH TIMES CONTINUE FOR COLLEGE 
Four current and ex Long Bay College pupils and teachers have died in the last two months. 
Ex student Carissa Avison, who went missing in January, was found dead in Woodhill Forest on Auckland's west coast earlier this month. 
International student Peyo Crus, former student Rachael De Jong and former teacher Kim Gray also died. - Stuff
